414b1e55-8f11-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kara is a software engineer on the Angular team at Google and a co-organizer of the Angular-SF Meetup. Prior to Google, she helped build UI components in Angular for guest management systems at OpenTable.

416d45ad-f5fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Paco Galanes
416d45ad-f5fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Paco is a Senior Engineering Manager focused on extending the reach of the Android Auto platform. Before joining Android Auto, Paco worked on scaling up YouTube's video platform where he also was responsible for building their live video infrastructure. Previously he focused on speech technologies and multimodal interfaces while at Microsoft and Entropic, Inc. Paco earned a PhD. degree on Telecomunications from Universidad Politecnica de Madrid

41c38ec2-60f8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ciaran Downey
41c38ec2-60f8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ciaran joined the Google Cloud Messaging team late last year and immediately began working on tools that make it easier for developers to handle intermittent network connections in their apps. He graduated from California State University, Fullerton with a bachelor's in Computer Science. In his copious free time Ciaran enjoys snowboarding and dancing to the Guardians of the Galaxy soundtrack.

4253e3f3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Neto Marin
4253e3f3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Neto is a Developer Advocate experienced in mobile development, and working with Android since early releases. Based out of São Paulo, Brasil, Neto helps Brazilian developers to build high quality apps and be successful in Android ecosystem.

4309dbe7-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: James Kelly
4309dbe7-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: James Kelly joined Google in 2008 as a Product Manager he works on the Android for Work team in London. James was lead product manager for Android for Work in the Lollipop & Marshmallow releases and recently launched new features for businesses in the Android N Developer Preview. James is setting out to change the world of work so that every employee in every business can use an Android device in their job.

435a703e-2f05-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Junichi Monma
435a703e-2f05-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Extensive background in Japan team lead, technical program management, Android partner engagement since early days of Android. Prior to Google, Monma was a corporate officer in Aplix and P/L responsible for mobile and advanced technology research. Monma is also a founder of Java based mobile services with Japanese carriers in Sun Microsystems.

44b5fde1-11ef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Magnus Hyttsten
44b5fde1-11ef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Magnus works a Developer Advocate doing outreach for many of Google's Mobile Services. He is currently very excited about connecting all mobile devices to the information services Google provides through its data centers. On his spare time, he enjoys fixing errors reported by statically typed language compilers, and playing around with cron jobs running on cloud instances.

44cd40c9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Yigit Boyar
44cd40c9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Yigit works on building UI widgets and improving layout performance as part of Android UI Toolkit Team. Prior to Google, he was the Android Engineering Lead at Path.com where he was mostly focused on building application architecture, real time camera filters and buttery smooth UI performance. He received his bachelor's degree in computer engineering from Middle East Technical University, Turkey.

454053cf-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jihyun Chung
454053cf-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jihyun leads a team that helps support developers looking to broaden their global reach, using Google Play. In her daily job she works with top app developers in Korea in the lifestyle, shopping, and communications categories. Prior to Google, she built her career as marketer, merchandiser and business development manager around content business at top Korean companies. Jihyun earned her MPA degree at New York University specializing in international development and a bachelor’s degree in psychology from Seoul National University.

4551e0f9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Rajat Monga
4551e0f9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Rajat Monga works on the Google Brain team, where he leads TensorFlow—an open source machine-learning library and the center of Google’s efforts at scaling up deep learning. Rajat is particularly interested in learning from sequences, including video. Prior to Google, as the chief architect and director of engineering at Attributor, Rajat led the labs and operations. He was responsible for the design of Attributor’s core matching engine and also hired the founding engineering team at Attributor to build it out. A veteran developer, Rajat has worked at eBay, Infosys, and a number of startups.

4591ddb4-1d10-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Laurent Lec
4591ddb4-1d10-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Laurent Lec is a Software Director at SoftBank Robotics and the Team Leader of the Android project for Pepper. 

He previously worked for VMware on the ESX project, and has been involved in several kernel and operating system projects.

Laurent has an M.S. in Real-Time and Embedded Software from EPITA Engineering School in Paris, France.

4635020c-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Emily Stark
4635020c-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Emily Stark is a software engineer on the Google Chrome security team, where she focuses on efforts to make TLS/SSL more usable and secure. Previously, she was a core developer at Meteor Development Group, where she worked on web framework security and internal infrastructure, and a graduate student researching client-side cryptography in web browsers. She holds degrees in computer science from Stanford University and MIT.

48bf2931-3ff5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Brian Pullen
48bf2931-3ff5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Brian is an entrepreneur and designer currently working on Virtual Reality at Google. Previously he co-founded the award winning design firm Playground, the innovative financial startup, Big Terminal and the AR game company Swappz. He has also been design director at TWG, and a product advisor to many great companies and startups.

4a09dbe7-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Todd Kerpelman
4a09dbe7-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Todd Kerpelman used to be a game designer, until he tricked Google into hiring him as a Developer Advocate. He focuses on how Google libraries and services can make life better for iOS developers, and has worn out the brackets keys of at least three keyboards. Since learning Swift, however, he now spends most of his time saying things like, "Let's try re-writing that in a protocol-oriented style," and hoping nobody figures out he doesn't actually know what he's talking about.

4a39430b-c110-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Adam Glazier
4a39430b-c110-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Adam leads UX efforts across various VR projects, including Sound Design. While at Google, Adam also helped bring Chromecast from conception to launch. Prior to Google, Adam was at IDEO innovating and launching products across mobile, tv, smart home, home entertainment, education, automotive, financial, medical and the music industry.

4a53e3f3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Nathan Martz
4a53e3f3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Nathan Martz is the Product Manager for Google's VR developer tools, including the Unity, Android, and iOS SDKs. His team's mission is to "make awesome easy", to ensure that developing for Cardboard is just as easy as using it. Before joining Google, Nathan worked as a game developer at Double Fine Productions and LucasArts, where he worked on titles like Star Wars: Republic Commando, Psychonauts, Brutal Legend, and Sesame Street: Once Upon a Monster.

4b205e13-8b0a-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Andrew Tomkins
4b205e13-8b0a-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Andrew Tomkins is Director of Engineering in Google's Research and Machine Intelligence team.  His interests lie in algorithms, graphs, social networks, search, web analysis, and machine learning.  Prior to joining Google in 2009, he spent four years at Yahoo! where he served as chief scientist of search, and eight years at IBM's Almaden Research Center, where he served as chief scientist on the WebFountain project. He has authored over 100 technical papers and 60 issued patents.  He received Bachelors degrees in Mathematics and Computer Science from MIT, and a PhD in CS from Carnegie Mellon University.

4bdffcda-7df8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Eli Danziger
4bdffcda-7df8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Eli is a product manager at Google working on app promotion ads on YouTube.  Eli has been at Google for 5 years and previously led the product efforts around helping advertisers to make better video ads, and to improve the performance of their video campaigns.  Eli holds a BS from Columbia University.

4c083cab-b6f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kobi Glick
4c083cab-b6f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kobi is a Product Manager on Google Play, and is focused on making Play the best publishing platform for developers. With features like beta testing and store listing experiments, Kobi helps developers launch, iterate, and experiment to improve their apps and their businesses. Kobi earned a B.Sc degree in computer science with minor in cognitive science from the Hebrew University of Jerusalem.

4c51e0f9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Laurence Moroney
4c51e0f9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Laurence Moroney is a Developer Advocate at Google, working on mobile services, specializing in cross-platform developer technologies. He's the host of 'Coffee with a Googler' on the Google Developers channel, as well as countless Dev Bytes about mobile development topics. He's the author of more books than he can count, including best-selling programming and Science Fiction ones. When he's not Googling, he's currently working on the revival comics for the Stargate TV shows, and enjoying the geek cred that this brings!

4ccd40c9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jessica Brillhart
4ccd40c9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jessica is the principal filmmaker for virtual reality at Google. In 2009, she joined Google's Creative Lab where she spearheaded numerous award winning shorts and documentaries before joining the VR team in 2015. Since directing, WORLD TOUR – the first VR film made with the Jump ecosystem – Brillhart has continued traveling the world, filming and experimenting, all in an effort to better understand and help inform others about this emerging medium.

4d5dad8c-b4f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Alex  Russell
4d5dad8c-b4f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Alex Russell is a Software Engineer on Chrome team where he designs new features for the Web Platform and leads Chrome’s Standards work. He’s a member of ECMA TC39 , the committee standardizing JavaScript, and is an elected member of the W3C’s Technical Architecture Group where he works to improve the state of API design for the web.

His recent projects include Web Components, ES6 features including Classes and Promises, and Service Workers. Previously he helped build Chrome Frame and led the Dojo Toolkit project. Alex plays for Team Web.

4e096ec7-35f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Francis Ma
4e096ec7-35f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Francis Ma is a Sr. Product Manager in the Developer Product Group, leading initiatives to create products that help mobile developers build better apps and grow a successful business.  Prior to Google, Francis was a startup co-founder and software engineer.

4e35020c-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Doug Stevenson
4e35020c-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Doug is a Developer Advocate working with Google tools and APIs, with a careful eye on the Android developer experience.  He's built many Android apps and tools since starting with the platform in 2009, and has also worked across the full stack of technology for building mobile apps and web sites. Doug has previously bootstrapped the efforts of a number of startups, and has held positions at AOL and CompuServe.  Doug's first programming experience was at age 10 with an Apple II computer.

4f11113e-4613-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Rachid  El Guerrab
4f11113e-4613-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Gamedev and graphics architect. Art pipelines craftsman, since the early consoles. Loves coffee and self-modifying GPU-friendly code. Tech Project Lead for Google Spotlight Stories... A mobile movie theater in 360. A film festival for your pocket.

5082a340-7af8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Elena Kelareva
5082a340-7af8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Elena Kelareva is the Product Manager for the Google Maps Web APIs, including the JavaScript Maps API, used by over 2 million websites. She has a PhD in Computer Science from the Australian National University, and has previously worked as a Software Engineer at OMC International, building software that improves safety and prevents ship groundings at some of the world’s largest cargo ports.

5109dbe7-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Russ Ketchum
5109dbe7-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Russ is a Group Product Manager at Google where he acts as the Head of Google Mobile App Measurement and the Head of Google Tag Manager. In addition to his prior work as a product manager on several Google ads products, Russ comes from a startup background where he led product and engineering teams to launch multiple mobile and web apps.

5153e3f3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Colt McAnlis
5153e3f3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Colt McAnlis is a Developer Advocate at Google focusing on Performance & Compression; Before that, he was a graphics programmer in the games industry working at Blizzard, Microsoft (Ensemble), and Petroglyph. He's been an Adjunct Professor at SMU Guildhall, a UDACITY instructor (twice), and a Book Author. When he's not working with developers, Colt spends his time preparing for an invasion of giant ants from outer space.

5187c1a6-4613-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ivan Poupyrev
5187c1a6-4613-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Runs with scissors. Engineer-designer-interaction pioneer. Technologies that blend digital and physical interactivity. Fast Company's 100 Most Creative People in Business. Imagineer at Disney; Research at Sony. Serially curious.

5351e0f9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: George Mount
5351e0f9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: George is a software engineer working on the Android UI Toolkit team. His work focuses on animations and transitions, including Activity and Fragment Transitions as well as Android Data Binding. Prior to Google, George was a developer at Nvidia, Intuit, and Netscape, working on desktop UI and server applications. George earned his master's degree from Stanford University and bachelor's degrees from Oregon State University.

53708e98-e0f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Tony Ferreira
53708e98-e0f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
User Experience designer, Android Wear Team.

It is his responsibility to ensure that the overall user experience is considered and engaging. Prior to joining the Android Wear team Tony has worked as a UX designer on Android Camera, Auto Awesome Movies, Google Play Movies & the Android Youtube app.

Tony earned a Bachelor of Design degree in Graphic Design from Duncan of Jordanstone at the University of Dundee. Before joining Google he worked as a visual designer for London based design studio Native.

53cd40c9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Andrew Brogdon
53cd40c9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: As a developer programs engineer on the Ads DevRel team, Andrew coordinates outreach efforts for the Mobile Ads SDK. If you've read guides, downloaded sample code, or seen presentations on how to incorporate ads from AdMob and DFP in mobile applications, chances are you've seen his stuff.

53d5aab8-89fa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Scott Newman
53d5aab8-89fa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Scott is a software engineer working on accessibility with a focus on hands-free access of Android devices (see: g.co/voiceaccess). Before focusing on accessibility, he worked on collecting statistics for the Play Developer Console and developed image coverage analysis tools for Google TV. Scott earned
a bachelor's in computer science and applied math from Brown University.

543fbf9e-33f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ashutosh Joshi
543fbf9e-33f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Ashutosh is a Technical Lead Manager in the Android Location and Context team. He is the Technical Lead for Android Sensors team and defining a standard for a low power Context Hub for the Android ecosystem. Prior to joining Google, Ashutosh has held engineering and management positions at Qualcomm, Ericsson and Hughes working on sensors, GPS and communication networks.

Ashutosh earned a bachelor's degree in Computer Science from IIT Varanasi in India  and a masters in Computer Science from the University of Southern California, Los Angeles.

5491902d-1bef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Brigitte Hoyer Gosselink
5491902d-1bef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Brigitte Gosselink is a Principal at Google.org, where she leads grantmaking around technology and innovation to help address global challenges. Prior to Google.org, Brigitte worked at The Bridgespan Group and in international development for the U.S. Agency for International Development and an international NGO. She has an MBA from the Yale School of Management and a BS in Systems Engineering from the University of Virginia.

56370681-f3f9-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ina Fuchs
56370681-f3f9-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Ina is a Strategic Partner Manager on the YouTube Gaming Team, looking after Top Gaming YouTubers and Publishers across all of EMEA. She has been working at Google for more than 5 years, previously as a YouTube Ad Specialist on the Google Sales team and a Manager for Multi Channel Networks on YouTube. 

Katharina has earned an MBA from EGADE, where she was awarded for being best of class as well as a Diploma in International Business from the European School of Business, Germany. She speaks 5 languages fluently.

5ac3a793-e417-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Nathan Schloss
5ac3a793-e417-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Nate is a software engineer on the Web Speed Team at Facebook where he focuses on improving Facebook’s client side web performance. Nate also leads many of Facebook’s browser partnership/engagement initiatives. Prior to joining the Web Speed Team Nate worked on the Notifications Team where his projects included building Facebook’s browser push implementation. Nate holds a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science from the Johns Hopkins University.

5acd40c9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Nick Butcher
5acd40c9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Nick is an Android designer & developer who helps other designers and developers to understand and create beautiful material design apps.

5acfb07f-fa00-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Stephanie  Cuthbertson
5acfb07f-fa00-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Steph is the Group Product Manager for Android's IDE and developer toolchain. She joined Google in 2012 and has worked on both Search/Ads and Android. Prior to Google, she was at Amazon Web Service's GPM for Storage with responsibility for AWS's S3, Glacier, and other storage systems. Before AWS, she was a GPM at Microsoft where she spent 10 years working on developer tools, IDEs, and server management tools. Steph graduated with honors from Brown University.

5b1a0d70-8b0a-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Maya Gupta
5b1a0d70-8b0a-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Gupta founded and runs the Glassbox Machine Learning R&D group at Google Research. Before joining Google in 2013, Gupta was a professor at the University of Washington for ten years in electrical engineering.  As a professor, Gupta was honored by the PECASE award from Pres. George Bush for her work in classifying random signals, and received the 2007 Office of Naval Research YIP Award. Her Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering is from Stanford University (2003), where she was a National Science Foundation Graduate Fellow.  Gupta founded and runs the laser-cut jigsaw puzzle company Artifact Puzzles.   Gupta has also worked for Ricoh Research, NATO's Undersea Research Center, HP R&D, AT&T Labs, and Microsoft.

5bb0aed7-80f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Sridhar Ramaswamy
5bb0aed7-80f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Sridhar Ramaswamy oversees all of Google’s Ads and Commerce products, which include search, display and video advertising, analytics, shopping, payments, and travel. Joining Google as an engineer since 2003, he’s been an integral part of the growth of AdWords and Google’s advertising business. 

Prior to joining Google, Sridhar was a Director of Engineering for the analytics platform at E.piphany. He also held research positions at Bell Labs, Lucent Technologies, and Bell Communications Research (Bellcore).

Sridhar earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from the Indian Institute of Technology Madras, and his master’s of science and PhD in computer science from Brown University. He has published numerous papers on database systems and database theory, and holds several patents in that area.

5e5d1cf4-9dfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Aja Hammerly
5e5d1cf4-9dfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Aja lives in Seattle where she is a Developer Advocate at Google and a member of the Seattle Ruby Brigade. Her favorite languages are Ruby and Prolog. She's spent enough time carrying a pager to believe in good monitoring and development practices. In her free time she enjoys skiing, cooking, knitting, and long coding sessions on the beach.

5f547c79-e417-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Aditya Punjani
5f547c79-e417-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Aditya is a Senior UI Engineer at Flipkart where he works on different consumer products and leads the mobile web team. He is also responsible for all things web-performance. Most recently he worked on building Flipkart Lite and deploying it to a diverse set of mobile browsers. Prior to Flipkart, Aditya was a Front-End Engineer at HP.

5f5cd1d6-0717-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Dani Grant
5f5cd1d6-0717-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Dani is the product manager at CloudFlare focused on DNS products, the customer dashboard and CAPTCHA. Before CloudFlare, Dani founded Hackers of NY, was an intern on BuzzFeed’s product team, designed infographics for Young&Rubicam, and spent half a year on the Ogilvy team in Shanghai, China. She also spent time in Bhutan with a team using drones to transport medical supplies.

614dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Milena Nikolic
614dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Milena is an Engineering Manager on Google Play Developer Console team. In her role she focuses on stellar app publishing experience for developers and on pushing app distribution on Android to the next level. Milena has been at Google for over 7 years, working on number of products related to Mobile, Android and Search. She earned a Masters degree in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering from University of Nis, Serbia.

6179fbb6-e0f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kenny Stoltz
6179fbb6-e0f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kenny has helped bring new features to the Android Wear platform since 2014, making it more awesome when you're out running and cycling. He also launched Android Wear support for iPhones. Previously at Google was a Product Manager in Ads, Commerce, Local, and YouTube working in Zurich and London. Outside Google he founded two companies. He earned a B.A. Hons. in Computer Science from Cambridge University.

62181412-c11b-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jennifer Holland
62181412-c11b-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Over her 9 years at Google, Jennifer Holland has worked in Finance, Sales, and now Product. Jennifer is the Google Classroom and Expeditions Program Manager, and her team built both the Classroom and Expeditions products from the ground up by prototyping and testing extensively with teachers and students in schools around the world. 

In addition to her core responsibilities, Jennifer is actively involved in employee volunteering and started Google Reach - a corporate volunteer program for Google, is the founder and director of the Community Leaders Program - a digital literacy program offered in six cities, and is the committee lead for employee volunteering for the NYC office. Jennifer graduated from Fairfield University in Marketing and received a MBA from the University of San Francisco.

6251e0f9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ran Nachmany
6251e0f9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ran leads Launchpad Accelerator where he drives startups to become more successful and has been working with startups at different stages globally in the past 4 years. Ran has been building Android apps since the early days of Android 1.6 and is passionate about delivering delightful experience through apps, products and services. Prior to joining Google Ran has founded several startups, and spent several years building wireless systems and chipsets. Ran has been very active in multiple developers community including Google Developers Groups and was GDE.

62cd40c9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Francesc Campoy Flores
62cd40c9-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Francesc is a Developer Advocate for Google Cloud Platform and an avid gopher (the developer, not the animal) from Barcelona, based in San Francisco.

Before joining Developer Relations he was a Software Engineer for Google Adwords where he discovered and enjoyed the developer experience that Google offers to its engineers.

Now his mission is to make those technologies known and available to the outside world: Kubernetes, gRPC, and Go are just the beginning.

641919aa-bbf3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ryan Seys
641919aa-bbf3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ryan Seys is a Developer Programs Engineer at Google where he empowers people to build amazing products on top of Google's developer platform. Originally from Canada, Ryan joined Google fresh out of school after receiving a Bachelor of Engineering, Software degree from Carleton University. Prior to joining, Ryan also interned at Google, Mozilla, and various education startups where he discovered the magic of mixing teaching with technology. Ryan loves clean and concise APIs designed to artfully balance simplicity with functionality. He is currently focused on bringing big and beautiful apps to Android TV, while on the side exploring new possibilities for the Internet of Things. He also really likes coffee.

641c5884-1bef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Tom Holman
641c5884-1bef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Tom is the lead product manager for Google Sheets and is responsible for both Sheets’ developer-facing APIs and user-facing web, Android, and iOS applications.  Tom is also the product manager for Google Apps’ internal analysis, metrics, and experimentation efforts.  Previously, Tom was the product manager for the sharing model across Google Drive and the Google Docs editors.  Prior to joining Google, Tom was an associate with the Boston Consulting Group. Tom earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Virginia and an MBA from Stanford University.

684dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Shanee Nishry
684dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Shanee Nishry is a Software Engineer working on virtual reality experiences as part of the Google VR team. She's been involved with game development from the start of her career and with virtual reality ever since the first public Oculus Rift development kit came out in 2013. Today she is excited to work on new virtual reality experiences and share some of the best practices with you at Google I/O.

699382df-8ff6-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Tenghui Zhu
699382df-8ff6-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Tenghui is working in the Android UI Toolkit team at Google, with his passion and expertise in computer graphics. Prior to Google, he worked in Nvidia. Tenghui holds a M.S. in Computer Science from University of Virginia and a B.S. in Computer Science from Sun Yat-sen University.

6a4fc173-ac0f-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Dan  Lyons
6a4fc173-ac0f-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Dan Lyons is a journalist, novelist, and screenwriter. He worked at Forbes and Newsweek, created Fake Steve Jobs, worked on HBO's Silicon Valley, and has a new book out, "Disrupted: My Misadventure in the Start-Up Bubble."

6a563011-24fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Esteban de la Canal
6a563011-24fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Esteban is the tech lead for the Android Studio Profiling Tools team and also contributes to the overall Android Studio effort. Prior to Google, Esteban worked in the games industry developing console video games. Esteban holds two Computer Science degrees from the National University of La Plata, Argentina.

6a7c810f-26f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Anshuman  Kumar
6a7c810f-26f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Anshuman is a UX lead working on virtual reality experiences as part of the Google VR team. He joined Google in 2012 and has worked on the Google for Work products and the Google Self-Driving Car Project. He is passionate about design culture and has set up a UX-sprint and makerspace for Google designers. Prior to Google, Anshuman was a senior designer at Yahoo! and worked on their Ad platforms and Yahoo commerce properties. Anshuman has a Masters in Interaction degree from IIT Bombay and a bachelor's degree in Architecture from GCA, India.

6af02cde-20fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Aaron Malenfant
6af02cde-20fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Aaron is the lead software engineer for reCAPTCHA. Prior to Google, Aaron was a Staff Engineer at Jive Software focusing on mobile and third-party APIs. Prior to Jive he worked as an engineer manager at Cisco. Aaron earned a master's degree from Michigan State University in Computer Science and bachelor's degree from Kalamazoo College in computer science and math, where he graduated with honors.

6bea23cb-4a12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Marta Rey-Babarro
6bea23cb-4a12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Marta is a co-founder of the Design Sprint Academy at Google and the lead researcher for Corporate Engineering's UX team. She is changing the way in which teams work and design solutions with the user in mind, via design sprints and research. Design sprints help understand the space in which teams innovate, imagine multiple solutions, fine tune them, test to validate and converge into the most appropriate solution for the team.  Marta holds a PhD in Audiovisual Communication and a Master's degree in Human Computer Interaction.

6f0e1b32-a7fa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Tristan Emrich
6f0e1b32-a7fa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Tristan works on the Mobile Ads DevRel team where he provides support for AdMob and DFP publishers who use the Google Mobile Ads SDK. He also develops and maintains iOS example apps, written in both Swift and Objective-C, that demonstrate various implementations of the SDK. Tristan earned a bachelor's degree in Operations Management from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and a bachelor's degree in Computer Science from the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee.

6f4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Tor Norbye
6f4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Tor Norbye is the tech lead for Android Studio, and has worked on many of the features in the IDE (and is also the author of Android Lint.) Prior to joining Google in 2010, he worked for 14 years at Sun Microsystems. He has a master's degree in Computer Science from Stanford University.

6f9430be-1aef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Fergus Hurley
6f9430be-1aef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Fergus is a Product Manager on Google Play focused on App Excellence, helping developers build better apps for users. This includes customer interaction tools such as Ratings & Reviews to telemetry before and after release. He graduated from MIT with a Masters in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science and a BE in Electrical Engineering from UCC, Ireland.

6fd56b4f-3ff5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Mike Alger
6fd56b4f-3ff5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Mike Alger is an interaction designer working on user experience for VR at Google. After earning a bachelor's degree in digital media, he documented his "VR Interface Design Pre-Visualization Methods" online while focusing on volumetric digital design for his masters. He is passionate about bringing human-centered usability and design principles to the next generation of computing technologies and display formats.

6fda5c1b-8107-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Dan Sandler
6fda5c1b-8107-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Dan leads the Android System UI engineering team, which is responsible for the lockscreen, notifications, main system navigation, and everything else you see on your Android device that's not some other app. He joined the Android team in 2009, just before Donut launched. He holds a Ph.D. in computer science from Rice University.

70b667a4-8c11-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jeff Dean
70b667a4-8c11-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Jeff joined Google in 1999 and is currently a Senior Fellow.  He leads the Google Brain team, which applies large-scale machine learning to solve difficult problems in speech recognition, computer vision, language understanding, and other areas.  He has
co-designed/implemented major pieces of Google's search and advertising systems, and is a co-designer and co-implementor of
Google's distributed computing infrastructure, including the MapReduce, BigTable, Spanner and TensorFlow systems.  He received a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Washington in 1996.  He is a Fellow of the ACM, and a member of the U.S. National Academy of Engineering and the AAAS.

70f7b555-89f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Safa Alai
70f7b555-89f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Safa Alai has broad experience at Google having worked in Search, Advertising, Android and now Firebase.  Prior to Google Safa founded three startups and worked on multiple larger scale software projects and it is this experience that he has leveraged to lead the development of Firebase Remote Config.  In his spare time Safa likes to program Android Apps, think about meaning and philosophy and dabble into history.

714de472-17ef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Mat Scales
714de472-17ef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Mat is part of the Google Chrome developer relations team, helping developers to make sense of the ever changing Web Platform. Currently Mat spends his time writing tools and libraries to help developers who are making Progessive Web Apps.

722c69d6-95f7-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ibrahim Karahan
722c69d6-95f7-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ibrahim is a developer advocate at Google focusing on top travel industry partners. He guides them for successful integration of Google technologies to build the state-of-the-art mobile and web apps. His experience prior to Google includes software development in portfolio risk modeling at BlackRock, and research in multiobjective optimization and evolutionary algorithms at METU and UIUC.

74fe2f30-0617-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Michael Bailey
74fe2f30-0617-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Michael is Sr. Staff Engineer for the Android team responsible for American Express’ flagship consumer Android apps in the U.S. market. Development on these apps began in 2010. Since joining the company in 2008, Michael has worked on a number initiatives at American Express including analytics, enterprise content management, AmexLabs, iOS apps, international mobile applications, NFC payments, the U.S. homepage and the U.S. online card applications site. Michael holds a BS in Computer Science from Harvey Mudd College and an MS in Computer Science from the University of Southern California, where he specialized in computer security. Including the U.S. consumer apps that Michael works on, American Express has 8 Android apps in the U.S. Google Play Store and more in the international Play Stores.

75720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Nicolas Roard
75720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Nicolas joined Google in 2007, working over the years on various projects such as the Android Browser, implementing the Webview hardware acceleration pipeline for Android 3.0, and writing a scalable and non-destructive photo editor for Android 4.3/4.4. After a year building high-speed telemetry systems for robots, he came back to Android, and is now designing UI layout systems. Nicolas has a Ph.D. in computer science from the University of Wales, Swansea.

77582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Surma
77582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Surma is an engineer working with the Chrome team. He likes to cut himself on the bleeding edge, goes full-stack every once in a while and prefers good code over functional one.

778a8d87-7ff8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jonathan Rochelle
778a8d87-7ff8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jonathan is Director of Product Management at Google and a co-founder of Google Docs and Drive. He is now responsible for Google Apps for Education, which is actively used by more than 50 million educators and students, most recently launching Google Classroom and Expeditions. Prior to Google, Jonathan co-founded two start-ups (one was bought by Google in 2005) and spent 15 years as a software engineer and Engineering Manager in Financial Services. Jonathan earned a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science from the State University of New York at Albany.

7970c454-0017-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Michelle Moore
7970c454-0017-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Michelle Moore is Head of Digital Banking for Bank of America.  Moore is also responsible for ATM, Fraud, Call Centers, and Financial Centers Market Growth Strategy.  She has been with Bank of America for 13 years.

799b9153-0dfc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Husain Bengali
799b9153-0dfc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Husain is a product manager for virtual reality media at Google. He works on VR video playback, as well as VR photo capture and rendering in Cardboard Camera. Prior to Google, he worked in the Xbox group at Microsoft. Husain holds a bachelor's degree in operations research and engineering from Cornell University.

7a99432f-df19-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Paul Dillinger
7a99432f-df19-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Head of Global Product Innovation, Levi Strauss & Co. Aspen Institute Fellow. RISD designer-in-residence. Fashion designer. Brand developer. Professor. First Fulbright fashion design scholar. Passion for sustainability in design. Really likes denim.

7acca188-b0f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ali Abdelhadi
7acca188-b0f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ali is a Product Manager on Firebase, and a Googler of more than 4 years. He has a background in Biomedical Engineering and Software development. Ali spent a few years working with internet publishers and IT customers on various projects as a consultant before working as a Product Manager. He now helps the new generation of startups build great products using Firebase!

7c521e82-95f7-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jae Seo
7c521e82-95f7-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jae Seo is the Engineering Manager in the Android Media TV team, leading the live TV efforts for the Android TV platform, which include TV Input Framework and Live Channels app. Prior to Google, Jae specialized in embedded system development and digital TV technologies, and worked at Samsung Electronics, Korea to develop platform software for many best-selling TV products. Jae holds a Ph.D degree in Computer Science from Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology.

7d720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Aaron Rothman
7d720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Aaron is the product management lead for Play Store Apps & Games Search and Discovery. He has been at Google for 8 years, working in a diversity of areas including Gmail and Ads. He has Masters in Information Technology and a B.S. in Statistics, both from the University of Michigan.

7f4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Wale Ogunwale
7f4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Wale is the Technical Lead Manager for the Android ActivityManager and WindowManager framework components. Him and his team are responsible for developing Multi-Window on Android.

8184035a-20fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Vinay Shet
8184035a-20fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Vinay is the Product Manager for reCAPTCHA and Street View. He strives to design and build new products to delight users through innovative use of technology. Vinay has a Ph.D. in Computer Science, focusing on Computer Vision, from the University of Maryland. Prior to Google, he was Scientist at Siemens Corporate Research.

81bc0066-b7f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Riccardo Govoni
81bc0066-b7f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Riccardo joined Google almost 9 years ago after some time spent pretending to be a physicist. In 2011 he joined the Google Play team, back when it was still known as the Android Market. Today he is one of the engineering leads in Google Play looking after the developer ecosystem, where he helps mobile developers creating great, high quality apps and running successful businesses. When not on Play, he writes short novels in the form of carefully crafted Out-Of-Office messages.

8407b801-b2f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Stephan Somogyi
8407b801-b2f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Stephan Somogyi works in security and privacy product management at Google. His remit includes Safe Browsing, Google’s system that protects over a billion users worldwide from malware and phishing; End-To-End, a project to make strong encryption more usable; and a variety of other security and privacy efforts. Stephan is an advisor to Google Ventures, and also chairs the Privacy and Public Policy Working Group of the FIDO Alliance.

848011bd-14fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Rob Giampietro
848011bd-14fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Rob leads Google’s Material Design studio in New York, where his work focuses on design outreach, including Google Design’s editorial efforts and its annual SPAN Design & Technology conference. From 2010–2015, Rob was principal at Project Projects, a design firm in New York. Project Projects won the National Design Award in 2015. Since 2008, Rob has been a senior critic at RISD’s MFA Graphic Design program. He was an executive board member and vice president of AIGA’s New York chapter from 2007-2009, and he has received creative fellowships at the MacDowell Colony and the American Academy in Rome. He is a graduate of Yale University.

8554abe0-cff6-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Stewart Miles
8554abe0-cff6-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Stewart Miles is a software engineer at Google working on technologies for game developers.

85720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Sam Saccone
85720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Sam Saccone is an avid OSS contributor and web performance auditor.

85964429-2bf5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Alper Gungormusler
85964429-2bf5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Alper Gungormusler is a Software Engineer, focusing on spatial audio for Google Daydream. As a member of the Google VR audio team he works to enable immersive audio in virtual reality experiences. Before Google, he was part of Thrive Audio, an Irish startup company, which was acquired by Google in early 2015. Alper completed an MSc. degree in Computer Science (Interactive Entertainment Technology) at Trinity College, University of Dublin. Prior to the Thrive Audio project, his work focused on interactive audio systems and game development.

874dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Mekka Okereke
874dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Mekka Okereke leads the Google Play Commerce engineering team. He has a passion for customer focused commerce and product excellence.

Prior to Google, Mekka lead Appstore Developer Services engineering for Amazon.  At Amazon, Mekka helped launch the Amazon Appstore, and the Amazon In-App Payments API.

Mekka knows that inclusive teams build better products. In addition to his Play Store duties, Mekka serves as a global co-chair for the Black Googler Network (BGN).

88582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Peter Tan
88582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Peter is a software engineer working on Mobile and Search in Google. Prior to Google, Peter had worked in several startups and companies including Agawi, Netflix, and eBay. Peter earned a master's degree in computer science from Stanford University.

8931c7e2-400e-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ope Bukola
8931c7e2-400e-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ope Bukola is a product manager on the Google Classroom and Apps for Education team. She focuses on building tools that enable teachers and students to integrate technology in the classroom. Prior to Google, she was a product manager at Amplify Education, and managed partnerships at CK-12 Foundation, a provider open-source digital textbooks. Ope is a graduate of New York University, where she earned a joint degree in Economics & Mathematics.

8aa47d44-6719-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Blaise Bertrand
8aa47d44-6719-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Master of Creative for Google ATAP. Passionate about humanizing technology. Former IDEO Partner and Managing Director of IDEO Palo Alto. Exhibited in the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum. Award winner, lecturer, and holder of multiple design patents. Forward-thinking and provocative. Creator of Designs_On platform. Frenchman. Bien sûr.

8b4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Alex Faaborg
8b4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Alex Faaborg is on the Virtual Reality design team at Google. He has led the design of Android Wear, Google Now, and the Android OS on the Nexus 5. Prior to joining Google, Alex served at Mozilla as the principal designer on Firefox for five years.  Alex has a masters degree from the MIT Media Lab where he researched artificial intelligence, intelligent agents, and context aware computing. Alex’s interactive design work is based on fundamentals of human cognition and perception, from his background in Cognitive Science and Information Science at Cornell University.

8c720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Nithya Sambasivan
8c720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Nithya Sambasivan is a user experience researcher at Google, where she builds an understanding of Internet users and non-users in emerging markets to build global access solutions. Previously she worked at Google.org. She has a PhD. in Information and Computer Sciences from UC Irvine, where she focussed on technologies for low-income communities in India; and an MS in Human Computer Interaction from Georgia Tech. Prior to Google, she was a research intern at Microsoft Research India, IBM TJ Watson Research Lab and Nokia Research Center, Tampere.

8f033953-0617-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Iordanis Giannakakis
8f033953-0617-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Iordanis leads the Android team at Shazam. Previously he was a tech lead at Yahoo! working on Yahoo! Answers, and software engineer at The Cloud. He has experience building distributed applications that are scalable and performant.

8f4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Tal Oppenheimer
8f4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Tal is a product manager on the Chrome for Android team. Prior to joining the Chrome team, she worked on Google Apps and Local Search. She earned her bachelors degree in Neurobiology with a secondary focus in Computer Science at Harvard.

90582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Tamzin Taylor
90582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Tamzin helps apps & games businesses from the UK and Nordics find success on Android and Google Play. Prior to joining the Google Play team, Tamzin was Head of Android Business Development, Oceania and before that, enjoyed 15 years developing successful mobile content products for leading carriers including Virgin, Vodafone and 3 mobile. Previously a director on the national board of the Australian Interactive Media Industry Association, she earned a bachelor's degree in Manufacturing Management and a Masters of Business Administration from the University of Technology, Sydney, Australia.

90ea0cf2-4a12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Alex Cook
90ea0cf2-4a12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Alex coordinates design and engineering efforts across Search, Maps and Identity. Most recently he worked on the new Google identity where he led the redesign of Search. Previously he worked on Ads & Commerce where he managed the Google Wallet UX team and led the design of DoubleClick for Publishers. Alex earned a master's degree in Information Design and Technology from Georgia Tech and a bachelor's degree in English from the University of Georgia.

924b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Noah Falstein
924b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Noah Falstein has been a professional game developer since 1980 (Sinistar, Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis, Neuroracer), and was one of the first ten employees at LucasArts Entertainment, The 3DO Company, and Dreamworks Interactive.  He headed The Inspiracy, a game consultancy, and was the first elected Chairman of the IGDA, and design columnist for Game Developer magazine for 6 years.  At Google, Falstein contributes to game projects across the company, and engages with game developers as part of the Developer Advocacy team

92577170-b6f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Gus Gostyla
92577170-b6f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Gus looks after the VC & Startup ecosystem on behalf of Google Play and Android. He joined Google after running BD for startups like Flipboard and Inkling where he built large publishing partner ecosystems and mobile distribution deals with Samsung, Amazon, and others. After starting his career as an editor at the Red Herring magazine, he helped grow 3 startups before joining Microsoft during the launch of Xbox 360 where he looked after social, games, and mobile partnerships for Xbox Live and Windows Phone. Gus is a graduate of Middlebury College and the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth.

926941ee-52f8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Philip  Moltmann
926941ee-52f8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Philip works on the Android framework team focusing on USB and printing. He earned a Diplom-Informatiker from the University of Karlsruhe (TH).

93720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kaz Sato
93720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kaz Sato is Staff Developer Advocate at Cloud Platform team, Google Inc. He leads the developer advocacy team for Machine Learning and Data Analytics products, such as TensorFlow, Vision API and BigQuery. Kaz also has been leading and supporting developer communities for Google Cloud for over 7 years. He is interested in hardwares and IoT, and has been hosting FPGA meetups as a personal project.

9401aa36-8f11-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jules Kremer
9401aa36-8f11-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jules is a Technical Program Manager on the Angular team coordinating developer relations & partnerships.  Prior to Google, Jules worked at Microsoft on the SharePoint Developer Platform as well as with the developer tooling team for Microsoft Office development and spent many years as an application developer & consultant for some of the largest companies in the world. Jules has a bachelor's degree in computer science, loves to hike on secluded trails and being a total beer snob.

94aa85a2-19f8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Francesco Nerieri
94aa85a2-19f8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Francesco Nerieri is an engineering lead at Firebase, Google. His teams are responsible to develop innovative solutions for mobile and web notifications, as well as synchronization, management and remote configuration of mobile devices. With over 10 years of experience in the wireless communications and distributed systems fields, Francesco applies his expertise to direct the team's initiatives to advance mobile cloud technologies.

959cdd5b-7ff8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ajay Surie
959cdd5b-7ff8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ajay has been the lead product manager for Google Slides since launch in 2012. Ajay has also led various initiatives across the Docs editors and Google Drive including revamping accessibility, building offline editing, and enhancing sharing and collaboration. Prior to Apps, Ajay was a product manager for DoubleClick for Publishers, and a software engineer on Google Maps. Ajay earned a bachelors and masters degrees in Computer Science from Carnegie Mellon University.

964dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Addy Osmani
964dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Addy Osmani is a Staff engineer working with the Chrome team on Progressive Web Apps and tools for developer productivity. He currently leads up efforts like the Service Worker JavaScript libraries and Polymer Starter Kit and has previously worked on projects like Material Design Lite, Yeoman and the Chrome DevTools. Addy has also written books such as Learning JavaScript Design Patterns and has a regular show called Totally Tooling Tips with co-presenter Matt Gaunt.

9798f155-da07-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Gabe Cohen
9798f155-da07-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Gabriel is the director of product management for the Android OS, and has been baking up the fine desserts since Jellybean.

980a6e08-4b12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kevin Dame
980a6e08-4b12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kevin founded and leads YouTube’s Visioning Team, which helps product teams identify opportunities and craft a clear vision for their product. The Visioning team has helped set product direction for several successful products, most recently YouTube Kids and YouTube Music. Prior to YouTube, Kevin led design & strategy programs at IDEO for a wide range of Fortune 500 companies. Kevin uses a well-rounded skill set - part designer, conceptual thinker, researcher, engineer, business person, and storyteller - to identify and bring to life opportunities for innovation.

98582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Seth Thompson
98582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Seth Thompson is the product manager of the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine and the upcoming WebAssembly runtime. He is passionate about empowering developers with great tools, expressive languages, and productive open source communities.

98f8e147-400e-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Sebastian Amorim
98f8e147-400e-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: UX Design lead for Federated identity at Google

990cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Matt  Goodridge
990cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Matt is a product manager on the Android for Work team. In this role, he focuses on Google Play for Work, the app management platform and app marketplace for managed Android devices in the work place.  Matt has been leading app management for Android for Work for the last 18 months and before that worked on Google AdSense.  Prior to Google, Matt spent most of his career in product management and product development in companies including Vodafone, McKinsey & Co, SpinVox and AlertMe.

Matt has a MEng in Engineering and Computer Science from Oxford University, UK, where he graduated with honors.

9920621e-7e12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Wei Chai
9920621e-7e12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Wei is an Engineering Manager on Google Play apps search and discovery team. Her main focus is apps search ranking, personalized recommendations and machine learning for app discovery. Wei joined Google six years ago, after she got bored with being a researcher on learning to rank theories. She earned her Ph.D from MIT Media Laboratory on audio signal processing and machine learning.

999cfff9-9cfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Carter Morgan
999cfff9-9cfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Carter Morgan is a Developer Platforms Engineer at Google, where he gets to write code and give talks about his favorite tools -- Go and Kubernetes. Before Google, Carter was a programer for the United States Air Force and for Microsoft.  In his free time, he does standup comedy and teaches "Presenting with Charisma" to other Googlers.  When he's not writing code or making people laugh, you can find him on twitter @_askcarter.

99d2cafd-25f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Michael Ishigaki
99d2cafd-25f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Michael Ishigaki is a user experience designer and prototyper on Google's Virtual Reality team. Michael is passionate about blurring the line between designing and prototyping to push the envelope of user experience in emerging technologies. He joined Google in 2013 and previously worked on the Google Apps team. Prior to Google, he worked at Hattery in San Francisco, CA. Michael graduated from the University of California, Berkeley with a degree in Mathematics. He resides in Piedmont, CA with his wife Erica.

99e05db5-89f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Liam Byrne
99e05db5-89f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Liam is a Software Engineer who works on Google Cloud Messaging (GCM). In this role he focuses on the development of GCM on Android. Prior to Google, Liam was a Software Engineer developing microwave radios at Aviat Networks and an SMS gateway at Run The Red.

Liam earned a bachelor's degree in Computer Science and Physics at Victoria University of Wellington.

9a4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kat Fang
9a4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Kat is a software engineer on the Firebase team, working on a range of projects from the iOS clients to the realtime database to keeping the servers humming along. 

She graduated from MIT with a bachelor's and master's degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. Outside of work, she enjoys dancing, robotics, board games, and adventures.

9a720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Taylor Savage
9a720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Taylor is the Product Manager of the Polymer project and Google's web platform developer libraries. Prior to joining the Polymer team, Taylor worked on creating new front-end features on the Google Search page.

9aba67d4-b4f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Alex Sieke
9aba67d4-b4f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Alex is a Product Manager at Google focused on mobile web payments. Prior to joining Google, he worked as a web developer and product manager in the mobile commerce industry specializing in checkout optimization.  Alex earned a bachelor’s degree in economics and computer science from Princeton University.

9bbd7016-360b-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Alexei Czeskis
9bbd7016-360b-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Alexei designs and writes software for Google's identity, authentication, and security team. Since he joined Google in 2013, Alexei's goal has been to make authentication easier and more secure for all of Google's users. Towards this goal, he has been tightly involved with Google's strong second factor efforts and the standardization and open protocol development through the FIDO alliance. Prior to joining Google, Alexei worked at Amazon, Microsoft Research, and competed in cyber-security competitions. Alexei received his PhD in computer science at the University of Washington.

9fedbd57-9efa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Bret McGowen
9fedbd57-9efa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Bret is on the Google Cloud Platform team at Google, focusing on developer-oriented products like App Engine, Compute Engine, the Cloud Vision API, Firebase and more. He's currently an aspiring Node.js developer. Prior to Google, Bret came from Texas, having worked in the cloud industry at Rackspace as a software engineer building the RackConnect hybrid hosting product. Before that, he led engineering teams at e-commerce, non-profit and startup companies. He's often on the running trail, volleyball court or kickball field.

Bret earned a bachelor’s degree in computer science from Texas A&M University.

a032718a-14fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Rich Fulcher
a032718a-14fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Rich leads the UX team responsible for the Material Design System. He previous worked on the Android team leading UI efforts spanning both platform and apps. Prior to joining Google, he designed consumer experiences for TiVo, Sirius, Dell, and AOL.

a1e9582f-26f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Robbie Tilton
a1e9582f-26f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: I'm a UX Designer and Prototyper on the Google VR team. I worked on Google Glass prior to VR and explored interaction design for non-traditional displays at NYU ITP.

a24b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Larissa Fontaine
a24b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Larissa is a seasoned business development leader who currently leads Apps Business Development for Google Play.  In this role, she leads a global team that helps developers create high quality, innovative, and locally relevant apps.  Prior to Google Play, Larissa led global strategy and new business development for YouTube.  A former elite athlete, Larissa is a World Championship silver medalist and a 5-time NCAA All-American. She holds a BA in English, a BS and MS in Mechanical Engineering, and an MBA, all from Stanford University.

a2720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Andrew Scherkus
a2720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Andrew is a Software Engineer on the Cardboard team focusing on the intersection of virtual reality and multimedia. Prior to Cardboard, Andrew spent 6 years on the Chrome team leading the development of multimedia technologies and standards for the web platform. Andrew has a Bachelors of Software Engineering from the University of Waterloo and lives in Seattle.

a32eb11b-400e-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: John Hjelmstad
a32eb11b-400e-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: John leads the Identity Platform team at Google, which includes Google Sign In, Smart Lock for Passwords, and Firebase Authentication. Before Identity Platform, John built JavaScript infrastructure for Google, and before that led the Google Gadgets team.

a5b907a0-89f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Subir Jhanb
a5b907a0-89f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Subir is the engineering lead for Google Cloud Messaging. With over 7 years of experience in mobile technologies and distributed systems infrastructure, Subir has designed many APIs, messaging and data synchronization solutions for all mobile platforms. Prior to this, Subir designed and lead the push based sync infrastructure for Android.

a67b77da-0def-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jamal Eason
a67b77da-0def-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Jamal Eason is a product manager for Android developer tools & products at Google. He is responsible for setting the product roadmap and features that help Android developers make great apps.  Prior to Google, he worked on developer tools at Intel, worked as product manager at a mobile app startup, and was a telecommunications officer in the US Army.

Jamal earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from the US Military Academy (West Point), a master’s degree from UMUC, and a MBA from Harvard Business School.

a70cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jennifer Gove
a70cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jenny Gove is a User Experience Researcher at Google, where she conducts research on the use of mobile devices. Currently Managing an Ads UX research team, she has also managed the Apps research team in her 10 years at Google. Previously she held UX roles at Sun Microsystems and start­up, Zadu. In her spare time Jenny mentors for 500 Startups. Jenny started her career in academia, as a Lecturer at the Open University, UK. She received her Ph.D. from the University of Southampton in the UK.

a865be4b-77f8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Rahul Roy-chowdhury
a865be4b-77f8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Rahul leads Google Chrome’s product management team. In his role he is focused on delivering on Chrome's core values of of speed, simplicity, security and stability and on making developers successful on the web.

a942167a-3ef5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kellee Santiago
a942167a-3ef5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kellee Santiago works with game developers to bring unique experiences to Google's VR platforms. As former president and co-founder of thatgamecompany, Kellee developed one of the most prominent brands in independent and innovative game development, pushing the communicative possibilities of video games as a medium. She speaks around the world at video game business and entertainment conferences on innovation in games, entrepreneurship, games as art and better methods for video game development. In 2010, she became a TED Fellow and was recognized as one of The Ten Most Influential Women in Games of the Past Decade.

a94b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ben Frenkel
a94b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ben leads the developer experience efforts for the Play Games team. His team provides developers reusable, battle tested components that have become ubiquitous in successful mobile games, like achievements and leaderboards, and game management tools, like Player Analytics, in the developer console to help developers manage their business. Prior to Google, Ben was a management consultant at McKinsey, and previously worked in engineering, pre-sales, and business development roles. Ben earned his MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management, and his bachelor’s in Computer Science from the University of Arizona.

aa720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: John Schlemmer
aa720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: John leads the motion efforts for the Material Design team. He also led motion for Google apps like Inbox by Gmail, Google Calendar and Gmail. Before Google, John worked at Chicago-based agencies Razorfish and Design Kitchen doing broadcast and web-based motion graphics for clients like Motorola, Samsung, Target and Kraft. John earned a bachelor's degree in interactive media design with an emphasis on animation at the Illinois Institute of Art.

ab4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Wayne Piekarski
ab4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Wayne Piekarski is a Developer Advocate at Google, focusing on Android, Wear, and the Internet of Things. He has worked for 15 years in academia and industry in the areas of wearable computing, outdoor augmented reality, 3D user interfaces, and mobile devices, with a PhD from the University of South Australia. Wayne works to get developers excited about new mobile and wearable technologies, through conferences, social media, and training materials. He also works to advocate for developers within Google, ensuring developers have the right tools and information to support their work.

ab94cb23-1d10-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Randall Sarafa
ab94cb23-1d10-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Randall is a Product Manager at WhatsApp, responsible for designing new features across WhatsApp's various clients (like the WhatsApp/Google Drive integration!). Prior to WhatsApp, Randall was a Product Manager at Google, working on the Android team.

ac19ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Eunice Kim
ac19ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Eunice leads strategic product initiatives focused on kids and families for Google Play. Prior to Google, she was a Director of Product Management at Like.com, a Brand Manager at Pepsico, and a Senior Finance Manager at Adobe Systems. She also serves on the Board of Directors for Cure CMD. Eunice earned a bachelor's degree at Columbia University and a MBA at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.

ae08866e-7ef3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ram Parameswaran
ae08866e-7ef3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ram is a developer programs engineer on the Google Mobile Ads developer relations team. In this role, his recent areas of focus include support for the Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin, and rewarded video mediation. Ram earned a bachelor's degree in software engineering from Carleton University at Ottawa.

ae0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ilya Grigorik
ae0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ilya Grigorik is a web performance engineer at Google, co-chair of the W3C Web Performance Working group, and author of High Performance Browser Networking (O'Reilly) book. In short, an internet plumber.

ae749ae1-8407-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Alexander Hills
ae749ae1-8407-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Alex is an engineer on the Android Wear System UI team, and has been mainly responsible for notifications and the context stream. He joined Android Wear in 2015, right before the launch of Android Wear 1.3. He has both a Bachelors and Masters of Computer Science from Brown University.

b01de907-4613-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Rafa Camargo
b01de907-4613-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ara Engineering Lead. Accustomed to challenges. And mobile firsts. Globally. With teams from France to Beijing. Likes to cook up software, hardware, trouble and food. CNET 20 Most Influential Latino in Tech.

b109f54b-26f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Stefan Welker
b109f54b-26f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Stefan Welker is a Software engineer on Daydream Labs.  Prior to Daydream, he invented the OpenDive printable open source virtual reality device and worked on the Durovis Dive SDK, the first smartphone based VR device on the market. Before that he got a degree in computer science in Dortmund, Germany. He also achieved the title of Robocup Mid-Size world champion twice, and worked as an application engineer to help robots see at Vitronic - the machine vision people.

b1720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Fabian Schlup
b1720006-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Fabian is an engineer and technical lead on App Indexing. He has worked on APIs and developer products at Google for the last six years, including as a technical lead for the Google+ Platform and Google Calendar APIs. Fabian holds a Masters in Computer Science from the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (ETH).

b319ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ficus Kirkpatrick
b319ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ficus has been working on Android for the past ten years or so. He still thinks it's pretty cool.

b34dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Alistair Pott
b34dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Alistair leads Product Management for Play Commerce. In this role he focuses on enabling developer businesses globally. Prior to Google, Alistair led Retail Product Management at Zappos. Alistair studied computer science at the University of Cape Town.

b3a8ccea-89fa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jennifer  Kozenski Devins
b3a8ccea-89fa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jen works to make Google products universally accessible by consulting with teams on accessibility design practices and guidelines. She has also worked as a user experience design manager on products such as Google Search and Google Analytics. Prior to Google, Jen was an interaction designer at eBay and worked on the finding and buying experiences. Jen earned a master's degree in education with an instructional technology emphasis from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.

b50cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kirill Grouchnikov
b50cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kirill is a user interface engineer working on client side development since 1999 in a variety of UI toolkits and libraries that spanned Motif, MFC, VB, Ada, Delphi, Swing and SWT. He has worked at Google on the Android team since 2009.

b5c5bf13-3bf8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ashish Sharma
b5c5bf13-3bf8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ashish Sharma leads the Volta Team in Android that makes batteries last longer. Previously at Google, he developed the per-application tracking and controls for network data in Android, and also worked on the Google Cloud Messaging infrastructure. In his spare time, he enjoys hiking, meditation, and riding his motorcycle. Ashish earned a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of California, Santa Barbara.

b832a233-790d-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ravi Palanki
b832a233-790d-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ravi Palanki leads the Android Places API team at Google, and has been responsible for growing the API’s user base significantly. Prior to joining Google, Ravi started his career designing and standardizing 4G LTE technologies at Qualcomm. Subsequently he led Qualcomm’s indoor location research team, and was recognized by the company’s annual Distinguished Technical Contributor Award. Ravi has over 100 US patents, a PhD and MS in EE from Caltech, an MS CS from Stanford and a B.Tech EE from IIT Madras.

ba4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Adam Powell
ba4dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Adam has been a member of the Android framework team since 2009 working on UI, lifecycle management, support libraries and more. He enjoys helping developers build great experiences that connect people to the world around them.

bc0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Chet Haase
bc0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Chet is the lead of the Android UI Toolkit team at Google, where he works on graphics, animation, widgets, and anything else that puts pixels on the screen.
He's been known to write and perform comedy and also to speak at developer conferences like this one.

bd6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Brad Abrams
bd6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Brad Abrams is Group Product Manager on the Google Cloud Platform team where he is responsible for the developer experiences on the platform. Software development is one of the last areas of modern life not deeply enhanced by the cloud - Brad’s mission is to bring the power, scale and availability of the modern cloud to the art of software development.  
Prior to Google, Brad lead many developer efforts at Microsoft on products including the .NET Framework, ASP.NET, Silverlight and Visual Studio.   Brad published several books include the bestselling Framework Design Guidelines.

be582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Malte Ubl
be582512-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Malte Ubl is the tech lead of the AMP Project. He previously spent 5 years at Google making JavaScript based apps go fast and in his free time, he is one of the co-organizers of JSConf EU.

bee1a8af-9dfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jordan Tigani
bee1a8af-9dfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jordan is one of the original engineers working on Google BigQuery, and has written a book on the subject. In 2014, he used Google Cloud tools to predict 14 of 16 matches correctly in the FIFA World Cup. Prior to joining Google, Jordan worked at several startups, which ranged from building mobile social apps to web security to machine learning-based advertising. Jordan has a Bachelor's degree from Harvard University and a Master's from University of Washington.

c04b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ahmed Gad
c04b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ahmed is a Product Manager at Google Cloud Test Lab. He joined Google in 2012 as a Software Engineer working with Google Maps then switched to Product Management and joined the Google Developers group to help mobile developers improve the quality of their apps. Ahmed holds a BS in Computer Engineering from Alexandria University in Egypt, a MS in Computer Science from the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona in Spain and he's currently finishing his MBA degree at UCLA Anderson School of Management.

c14dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ellie Powers
c14dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ellie Powers leads product management for developers on Google Play, enabling them build to successful global businesses and high-quality, innovative apps. Prior to Google, Ellie has built products at large companies and startups in California, Paris, and London. She has a degree in computer science from MIT and was voted funniest person in Silicon Valley in 2016.

c2bd9e9a-4a12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Nicholas Jitkoff
c2bd9e9a-4a12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Nicholas is a design lead on the Material team, a group that drives cross-platform design and implementation. In his time at Google, he has contributed to both web and mobile through Chrome, Chrome OS, Google Search App, Voice Search and more

c2d5429b-9ef6-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Fontaine Foxworth
c2d5429b-9ef6-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Fontaine is a Product Manager focusing on mobile app analytics. Under this umbrella she has worked on features to expand install attribution, publisher reporting, and in-app activity.  Prior to Google she worked as a Product Manager at ModCloth, an eCommerce company. There, she was a daily practitioner of Google Analytics while she built a mobile website as well as iOS and Android apps.  She has a BS in Civil Engineering from Stanford University.

c319ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Purnima Kochikar
c319ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Purnima Kochikar is the Global Director of Apps and Games business development at Google Play where she oversees all aspects of the app ecosystem including strategy, operations, partnership management, technical support and developer marketing. Her team helps the world’s leading companies and fledgling entrepreneurs build successful mobile businesses. 

Purnima is passionate about K-12 education and entrepreneurship. A self professed geek, she is a tinkerer (her first toy was a meccano set), traveller, bookworm and budding chef. She serves on the board of Silicon Valley Forum.

c32df88f-f6fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: German Bauer
c32df88f-f6fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: With many years of expertise in Industrial Design and UI Design, German loves to explore the intersection of physical and digital user experiences. Currently working on the Android Auto OS platform, German was part of the Android team since it's launch. Before Google, he designed products for Apple, Netscape, Adobe and medical technology companies, as well as a number of hardware and software startups.

c41185dc-8dfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Pali Bhat
c41185dc-8dfa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Pali Bhat is the Senior Director of Product Management at Google leading all Payments products globally. Prior to Google, Pali was a Vice President of Product Management at SAP Labs. He has also been a consultant for McKinsey & Co.

Pali has earned an MS in Computer Science from University of Illinois @ Urbana Champaign and an MBA from Duke University.

c4bcaed0-f50a-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Sameer Samat
c4bcaed0-f50a-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Sameer is a Vice President of Product Management, leading the Play team at Google. During his 7+ years at Google, Sameer also led the Commerce team as a PM director & the Shopping/Travel Teams as a VP of PM.

Prior to Google, Sameer was the President of Jawbone. Sameer founded two vertical search and text mining companies, raising venture financing from several firms. Sameer also served as Executive Vice President of Products at Kofax.

Sameer holds a BS in Computer Science from University of California, San Diego and is a graduate of the Harvard Business School.

c4f31165-0417-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Etienne Caron
c4f31165-0417-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Etienne is a software developer who's worked on all tiers (server, web, mobile and embedded) of large scale software platforms. He is an Android GDE, and Mobile Dev Lead for Shopify.

Etienne has been an active member of the Android developer community in Montreal since 2010, and regularly devotes his time to mentoring startups, developers and students in the mobile space. 

Previously, Etienne worked on projects ranging from high-availability stock trading software platforms, all the way to large scale municipal bike sharing systems (London's cycle Hire amongst others). He lives in Montreal with his wife and daughter, and speaks French and English fluently.

c51eb333-e517-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Shainiel Deo
c51eb333-e517-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Shainiel is the CEO of Halfbrick Studios, Australia’s largest independent gaming studio and the team behind mobile mega-hits such as Fruit Ninja and Jetpack Joyride.
