He has previously served as president of the Game Developers Association of Australia (GDAA), and was formerly the president of Electronic Games Queensland. When he isn’t jet-setting around the world speaking with other executives of the video game world, he can be found playing Fight Night or fishing in the mud with no shoes.

c533510b-f60a-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Bob Meese
c533510b-f60a-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Bob oversees global business development for games on Google Play. His team works with mobile games developers worldwide to help them grow their businesses on Android, and works closely with products teams to influence development of key areas including development, monetization, discovery and engagement.

c7444281-a60f-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Owen Campbell-Moore
c7444281-a60f-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Owen works with Chrome's Web Platform team to bring powerful new capabilities such as push notifications to the web. More recently he has focused on understanding and meeting the needs of Progressive Web App developers.

Prior to Google he was an engineering consultant to London-based VC firm Loxbridge Research and worked in product and business development for the company that is now GoCardless (YC S11).

Owen earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from the University of Oxford and enjoys writing JavaScript in his free time.

c7e78c69-7c1c-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Brady Forrest
c7e78c69-7c1c-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Brady co-founded Ignite Talks, which he recently reacquired from O’Reilly Media and relaunched as Ignite Talks PBC. He runs Highway1, PCH's Hardware Accelerator, and is always on the lookout for the next hardware startup.  Brady's on the board of CAST, a non-profit that helps arts organizations stay in the Bay Area. He previously worked at Khosla Ventures and Microsoft.

c94dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Dominic Preuss
c94dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Dominic is the product lead for storage and databases on Google Cloud Platform. He is in his second stint with Google where he was previously the product manager for local advertising in Adwords from 2004-2007. In between, Dominic was the Chief Product & Technology Officer at SecondMarket and worked at several other startups in New York City. Dominic holds a Bachelor of Science in Engineering (BSE) degree in Biomedical Engineering from Duke University.

c9d67cfa-8007-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Romain Guy
c9d67cfa-8007-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Romain works on Android graphics and UI technologies at Google.

ca19ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ankur Kotwal
ca19ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ankur is a Developer Advocate experienced in building on Android and the Google Maps APIs. Based out of Sydney Australia, Ankur leads the Geo Developer Relations & Next Billion Users Developer Relations team to inspire developers towards building on the Google developer platform. Ankur is also a founding member and software engineer for Google Santa Tracker on Android.

cb911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Matteo Vallone
cb911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Matteo Vallone is a business development manager at Google Play in London. In his role, he helps apps and games businesses to find success on Android and Google Play. Matteo joined Google 8 years ago as a member of the YouTube strategy team and then worked as a product manager for YouTube, prior to joining Google Play 2 years ago. Before Google, Matteo worked as a consultant for Bain & Company.

cc6a02ce-89f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: James Tamplin
cc6a02ce-89f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: James cofounded Firebase in 2011 and served as CEO until Firebase joined Google. He now is a product lead for Firebase. James founded three startups prior to Firebase and had a stint as a stage actor in New York City. James is a Y-Combinator alumni and earned a bachelor's and master’s degree in Industrial and Systems Engineering from the University of Wisconsin.

cd6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Noor Ali-Hasan
cd6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Noor is a senior user experience researcher at Google, where she has focused on understanding user behavior and needs around various consumer products including the Android smartphone experience, Google Now, and Chromecast.  Prior to Google, Noor's research focused on interactive and smart TV products at Microsoft and Samsung Electronics. Noor holds a masters degree in Human-Computer Interaction from the University of Michigan.

cdadd74d-ff0b-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Avnish Miduthuri
cdadd74d-ff0b-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Avnish Miduthuri is a product manager for Android Pay, focusing on mobile checkout and in-app payments for physical goods and services. Previously, he led technical partnerships to integrate Google's payments solutions with key partners including card issuers, payment networks, processors and e-commerce merchants. Prior to Google, Avnish worked on microprocessor development as a member of technical staff at AMD. Avnish earned his bachelor’s degree from the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras and a masters degree in Computer Engineering from the University of Texas at Austin

cf2ac2bf-b4f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Rouslan Solomakhin
cf2ac2bf-b4f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Rouslan is a Chrome software engineer. He works on payments and spellcheck. Prior to Google, Rouslan worked on cloud platforms and full disk encryption suites. Rouslan earned a bachelor's degree in computer science with a minor in software engineering from Clarkson University and a master’s degree in computer science from Dartmouth College.

cf4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Dan Galpin
cf4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Dan has spent the past six years advocating for NDK and game developers on Android.  He has also co-authored Android Fundamentals and Advanced Android with Udacity.  Prior to Google, Dan developed mobile phone software for Sprint, Motorola, Sanyo, and others, as well as an Android video series and was a technical reviewer for several Android books.  He graduated with a degree in Computer Engineering from the University of California, Santa Cruz.

d04dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Mike Procopio
d04dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Mike is a Staff Software Engineer at Google and leads the Google Drive API team. He's passionate about third-party developers and their experience, and is especially interested in integrations between Android and Drive. Mike holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Colorado, where he studied Machine Learning and Autonomous Robot Navigation. When not slingin' code on Drive, Mike can be found running along the trails near his home in Boulder, Colorado.

d119ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ian Lake
d119ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ian Lake is a developer advocate focused on the Android framework and the Android Support Library, although you'll always find him with at least a few wearable devices on. Prior to Google, he worked as an Android developer at Facebook and Phunware. Ian received his Masters in Computer Science from the University of Southern California and a Bachelors of Science in Computer Science and a Bachelors of Science in Physics from Montana State University.

d30cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kai Haley
d30cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kai Haley is a UX designer leading the Design Relations team at Google. She is one of the lead trainers for Sprint Master Academy and has spent the last 2 years training over 200 Sprint Masters across Google's diverse product areas. She is passionate about design thinking and inspiring the UX community to effectively utilize Design Sprints for speed and innovation. Her UX expertise has been centered on creating monetization opportunities, most recently on the Search Ads Team, and prior to Google, on the Yahoo! Front Page. She earned a Masters Degree in Design from CCA, where she focused on sustainable design.

d46c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Dan Aminzade
d46c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Dan Aminzade is a software engineer on the Android Wear team.

d5718648-5e03-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Dake  Gu
d5718648-5e03-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Dake Gu is a Software Enginneer working in Android TV Leanback Support Library team at Google.  Prior to Google, Dake Gu worked for Palm and HP.

d71387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Mike Denny
d71387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: As a Design Advocate, Mike spends most of his time helping companies outside of Google to design products using the material design system and design sprints. Advocating for good design, more than merely evangelizing Google's ideas, Mike listens to and shares external feedback with the various teams within Google to improve the design and development experience across all platforms. Before joining the Google Design team, he founded a consultancy and worked with several mobile startups.

d74b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Steve Ganem
d74b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Steve is a Product Manager of Google Analytics, overseeing the SDK and its integrations with other Google products and services.  Prior to Google, Steve spent 19 years in the video game industry, starting with Virgin Interactive (EA) and Neversoft (Activision), where he was the lead tools and online engineer for Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3, 4 and Underground.  He then went on to found SuperVillain Studios - an independent studio in Southern California - where he served as CTO and CEO for 11 years.  Steve earned a bachelor's degree in Information and Computer Science from the University of California at Irvine.

d74dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Sascha Prueter
d74dfcff-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Sascha is heading up the Android TV product, working within the Android Engineering and Product Management teams on the TV experience, linear TV integration, PayTV support and gaming space for Android TV. He previously led the overall Android platform Program Management to release new Android operating system versions to phones and tablets across the world. operators on deploying IPTV systems in international markets.

d7e88f6c-5212-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Miles Barr
d7e88f6c-5212-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Engineering Director for Google Play Developers

d8e353b6-33f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: David Christie
d8e353b6-33f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: David is a developer on Location APIs within Google Play services including the fused location provider and geofencing.  His focus includes both reduction in battery consumption of location services and improvement in outdoor/indoor location accuracy.

d9375790-080b-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Scott Jenson
d9375790-080b-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Scott Jenson is the project lead for the Physical Web at Google. He's mission: to allow anyone to walk up an use anything, with just a few taps.

d9911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Mandy Waite
d9911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Based in London, UK, Mandy is a Developer Relations Engineer at Google specializing in Container and Cloud technologies and working to make the world a better place for developers building applications for the Cloud. Before Google Mandy worked at Sun Microsystems on performance and scalability of Java and JavaEE and on porting Open Source apps to OpenSolaris. In her spare time Mandy is learning Japanese and likes to play the guitar.

da68311b-0517-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Royi Benyossef
da68311b-0517-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Royi is the developer and community relation programs manager for Samsung's innovation center in Tel-Aviv as well as an Android GDE.

An Android developer since 2009 Royi has accumulated experience in project and team management as well as gained expertise in Android development, UX, software architecture, performance analysis and troubleshooting as well as internals.

As an avid community man Royi mentored many start-ups and has appeared on international stages and on the web as a speaker and advocate for Android.

daa0beca-52f8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Svet  Ganov
daa0beca-52f8-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Svet is an engineer on the Android Framework team. He is the lead for the permissions architecture, print framework and accessibility framework. He also worked on app widgets, UI toolkit, settings and other components. He has a master's in software engineering from the University of Texas at Austin, USA and a master's in international business from the University of National and World Economy, Bulgaria.

db0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Todd Hansen
db0cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Todd has been working on Google Cloud Messaging for the past seven years focusing on performance, reliability, and scalability. Before Google, Todd helped build a county scale high performance wireless network while working for the San Diego Supercomputer Center. He earned both a masters degree in Geophysics and a bachelors in Computer Science from UCSD. He enjoys spending time with his family, hiking, woodworking, and amateur radio.

dbe48e85-3ff5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Lindsay Metcalfe
dbe48e85-3ff5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Lindsay Metcalfe is a Design Manager on Google’s Virtual Reality team, helping the team craft meaningful experiences and make new things possible in VR. She joined the Google VR team from Android, where she defined user experience for Android@Home’s home automation and living room initiatives, and provided design leadership for Android TV as it grew from a pilot project to a new entertainment platform. Prior to Google, Lindsay led multidisciplinary teams and design programs for Palm’s webOS and frog, a global design and strategy consultancy. Lindsay holds a B.A. in Cognitive Science from Occidental College.

dc6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Julie Aranda
dc6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Julie is a senior UX researcher at Google, focusing on understanding user behaviors on mobile products.  She has been leading ethnographic research efforts on topics such as Accessibility and Notifications. Prior to Google, Julie conducted user research at eBay, Yahoo!, Palm, and LeapFrog.  Julie holds a Bachelor's degree from UC Berkeley and a PhD in Psychology from the University of Oregon.

de1387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Meghan Desai
de1387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Meghan Desai is a Product Manager at Google working on Android framework battery and memory management features. He has previously worked on Google's Big Data platform. He is passionate about building products that are simple, seamless, and intuitive to use. An engineer at heart, Meghan enjoys building Android apps, tinkering with microcontrollers, and studying oenology. He has a BS in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Cornell University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

de4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Matt Gaunt
de4b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Matt Gaunt,
Senior Developer Programs Engineer

Matt is currently spending his days working on the open web, helping developers and representing their needs to the engineers working on Chrome (he's super excited about push notifications and offline support for web apps). Before working on Chrome he helped with the launch of Google TV and Chromecast in Europe and prior to Google Matt was busy building native mobile applications.

deaae621-7918-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Aparna Chennapragada
deaae621-7918-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Aparna Chennapragada is a Senior Director of Product Management at Google. She most recently led Google Now, driving efforts to assist users with proactive information. She is a thought leader and product leader in information discovery, having led multiple efforts across Google Search and YouTube. Aparna has a Masters in Management and Engineering from MIT, Masters in Computer Science from UT Austin and a Bachelors in Computer Science from Indian Institute of Technology, Madras.

df985722-0302-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jerome Dochez
df985722-0302-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jerome is a software developer at Google and the tech lead for the Android Plugin for Gradle. He spends most of his time developing new features and ensuring the stability of the Android build system.

dfb91efa-bffa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Max  Christoff
dfb91efa-bffa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Max Christoff leads the Android Pay engineering team at Google. He is focused on transforming commerce with delightful mobile payment experiences.

Prior to Google, Max was CTO of Enterprise Infrastructure at Morgan Stanley and has held a variety of technology engineering and software development roles including mobile applications, real-time communications, web technologies, and financial applications. Max earned his Bachelor’s degree at Columbia University and his Master’s at Princeton University.

e119ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Oli Lan
e119ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Oli is a senior engineer on the Android Wear team. He leads work on system UI and watch faces, and also built the emoji recogniser for Wear and Wear's media controls. Before joining the Wear team, he also worked on G+ Year In Review, Auto Awesome Movies, and Chrome for Android.

e1911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Mark Wei
e1911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Mark is a user interface and motion engineer on the Material Design team. He previously worked on the Android team for Gmail and Inbox. Mark earned his bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from the University of California, Berkeley.

e1a2f3ab-b2f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Leon Nicholls
e1a2f3ab-b2f3-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Leon is a Staff Developer Programs Engineer on the Google Developer Relations team, working on IoT and web technologies. He is the developer of samples, codelabs, client libraries and documentation for various Google SDK's and API's including Google Cast, Android Wear, Android TV, Android Auto and Chrome.

e20cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Prakash Hariramani
e20cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Prakash Hariramani is a senior product manager in the Android Pay team. His mission is to drive an amazing in-store payments experience on Android. Prakash started his career in financial services and then moved to mobile and then decided to combine the two. Prakash has a Bachelor's degree from Franklin & Marshall College and a Master of Science from Carnegie Mellon University

e25bafd6-14ef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Carrie Rowe
e25bafd6-14ef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Carrie manages Early Access Programs for Google and is a Program Manager with Developer Relations. She has been with Google for six years and enjoys helping make developers successful on Google Platforms. Carrie earned a bachelor degree in finance from New York University.

e2cf0634-5615-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Alex  Rickabaugh
e2cf0634-5615-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Alex Rickabaugh is an engineer on the Angular team, focused on enabling great experiences on mobile devices with Progressive Web Apps. Alex has been at Google for 5 years, working on CRM software for the sales organization as well as data access libraries.

e36c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jake Archibald
e36c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Jake is developer advocate for Google Chrome. He wants the web to do everything native can, and fast. He's one of the editors of the service worker spec, so he's into offline-first, push messaging and web performance.

(Google suggested we add our "education" to our bios, so FYI I have a high school qualification in French. I can't speak French)

e400107a-1bef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Patrick Osborne
e400107a-1bef-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: American animator, writer and director. 2014 OSCAR winner for Best Animated Short, Feast. Big Hero 6. Wreck-It Ralph. Bolt. Creator of 7th Google Spotlight Story, Pearl. First to be produced as a 360, theatrical, VR story and to premiere at a major film festival.

e64b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Nicolas Geoffray
e64b9edb-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Nicolas Geoffray is a software engineer working on the ART project. He is responsible for the new optimizing compiler introduced in Android Marshmallow, and its transition to JIT for the upcoming N release. Before ART, he helped shape the Dart language and its efficient translation to JavaScript. Nicolas holds a PhD in computer science from the University of Pierre et Marie Curie, Paris, France.

e805fd81-33f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Steve Malkos
e805fd81-33f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Mr. Malkos is the Technical Program Manager in the Android Location and Context Group at Google.  He manages all engineering aspects for Android’s Location and Context programs.  Mr. Malkos is responsible for defining these initiatives within Google which includes everything from GPS, Fused Location Provider (FLP), Android Sensor Hub, Sensors, and more.  Mr. Malkos has been involved in the field of location now for over 13 years.  Prior to his role at Google, he worked as an Associate Program Management Director at Broadcom, where he managed engineering teams within Broadcom’s GNSS software.   He holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Purdue University, currently holds 8 patents and has many more pending patents in the field of location.

e90cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Griff Hazen
e90cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Griff is an engineer and technical lead on the Android Wear project, with a focus on the Android Wear SDK. He previously worked on Google+ and Google Groups. Griff earned a bachelor's degree in computer engineering from the University of Washington with a research interest in robotics.

e919ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Belinda Langner
e919ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Belinda Langner is a Product Manager at Google working on mobile Search advertising. She is currently focused on improving app install ads and was heavily involved with Universal App Campaigns. Prior to Google, she worked as an engineer at IBM. Belinda holds a BS from Carnegie Mellon University.

e9911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ben Weiss
e9911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Ben is a Developer Programs Engineer on the Android Developer Relations team. He focuses on making Android apps more delightful.

Ben works within the Android ecosystem since 2009, being driving force behind several Android applications.
He also organized the GDG Berlin Android, was an Android GDE and established a Guinness World Record.

e9ac50fe-20fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ying Liu
e9ac50fe-20fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ying Liu is a software engineering manager at Google. She is passionate about fighting spam and making life easier for internet users.

eb43fb23-8afa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Michal Waltner
eb43fb23-8afa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Michal Waltner, Program Manager and lead of Campus Tel Aviv. Campuses, operated by the Google for Entrepreneurs team, are a global network of spaces for entrepreneurs to learn, connect, and build companies that we hope will change the world. Campus members get access to mentorship and trainings from experienced entrepreneurs, and teams from Google. Before joining the Google for Entrepreneurs team, Michal was a Community Manager on the Developer Relations team in Israel and was part of the founding team of Campus Tel Aviv 3.5 years ago. Michal holds a LL.B in Law, M.A and B.A in Communications , all from Tel Aviv University.

eb4c8b11-371a-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Dave Dearman
eb4c8b11-371a-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: David is a user researcher on Google's virtual reality team. Prior to Google, he was a user research at Twitter, where he focused on Timeline consumption, Tweeting and understanding user motivations. He holds a PhD in Computer Science from the University of Toronto where he specialized in human-computer interaction and mobile computing.

eb6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Marc Bachinger
eb6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: As a Developer Advocate for media, Marc works with large media partners to help them be successful on the Google platform. Marc worked with many video apps to help them to adopt ExoPlayer for their application. Prior to Google, Marc was a Software Architect and Engineering Consultant for almost two decades. He earned a degree in Sociology and Economic History at the University of Zürich with a focus on macro economical innovation theories.

ed6ec7f2-4513-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Daniel Kaufman
ed6ec7f2-4513-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Former Director of Information Innovation at DARPA... aka DARPA Dan. Dreamworks Interactive head. Softie for software. Passionate about cyber. Lover of big data. Lecturer. Author. Turning today's cutting edge ideas into tomorrow's cutting edge products. Commander of the ATAP pirate ship.

ee18c49a-a2ff-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Eric Leichtenschlag
ee18c49a-a2ff-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Eric joined Google almost 5 years ago and manages the developer relations teams for the Google Mobile Ads and IMA SDKs. His job is to make it as easy as possible to integrate display and video ads into your apps. His current focus is making innovative ad formats like rewarded video and native ads work better in games. Eric received his Bachelors of Science in Computer Engineering from the University of Florida.

ee72244c-11f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Mathieu Chartier
ee72244c-11f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Mathieu Chartier is one of the engineers working on ART and wrote a large portion of the ART GC that has been in use since Lollipop. Prior to Google, Mathieu earned a bachelor's degree in computer science from the University of Waterloo.

f019ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Johnny Lee
f019ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Johnny Lee is the lead of Project Tango at Google - which is a focused effort to bring computer vision and advanced sensor fusion to mobile platforms. Previously, he helped Google X explore new projects as Rapid Evaluator and was a core algorithms contributor to the original Xbox Kinect. His YouTube videos demonstrating Wii remote hacks have surpassed over 15 million views and became one of the most popular TED talk videos. In 2008, he received his PhD in Human-Computer Interaction from Carnegie Mellon University and has been recognized in MIT Technology Review’s TR35.

f1911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Jacob Wenger
f1911d18-c3ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Jacob helps build extraordinary experiences for developers as a software engineer on the Firebase team. He has worked on many different parts of Firebase and is an active contributor to many of Firebase's open source libraries, including ReactFire and GeoFire. Jacob has been with Firebase since its startup days and was previously a developer on the Internet Explorer team at Microsoft. He graduated with a computer science degree from the University of Notre Dame.

f2b75679-f6fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Gregory Neiswander
f2b75679-f6fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Greg Neiswander leads the research team for Android Auto and focuses on optimizing in-vehicle experiences while minimizing distraction.  Prior to Google, Greg spent his career as a human factors and safety expert in both the automotive and aerospace industries. Over the years, he has researched and designed interfaces for a variety of platforms including automobiles, helicopters, unmanned systems, and fixed-wing aircraft. In addition to his role at Google, he also serves as an industry expert in the Society of Automotive Engineers’ Human Factors Steering Committee and the ISO Ergonomics technical committee.

f36c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Safia Baig
f36c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Safia is User Experience Researcher on Android. In this role, she focuses on mobile phone experiences. Prior to Google, she was a UX Researcher at a research and design consultancy. Safia earned a master's degree in Psychology from California State University, Long Beach.

f43ae3a0-df17-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Dan Cernoch
f43ae3a0-df17-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: As Director of Abuse Prevention at Ticketmaster, Dan leads the mission to protect fans and clients from the actions of “bad actors.” He is responsible for the development and deployment of products that keep the bots out, get fans in, and protect their accounts from bad guys. Prior to Abuse Prevention, Dan led the Ticketmaster Payment Services programs. Before Ticketmaster, Dan worked at a variety of places in Software Engineering, QA, Project and Product Management. He is passionate about mathematics, cryptography, toy robots and going to live events. Dan graduated with Highest Honor from West Chester University in Pennsylvania.

f4dbcfd4-23fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Siva Velusamy
f4dbcfd4-23fc-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Siva is a software engineer in the Android Studio team. Prior to Google, he wrote embedded software and tools at Xilinx Inc. He holds a Masters degree in Computer Science from the University of Virginia.

f51387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Monica Dinculescu
f51387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Monica works on the Polymer Elements team, making pretty and accessible widgets for everyone to use. Before this, she worked on Chrome for two years, so she's pretty sure she has at least once broken the Internet for you.

f6a4176d-11f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Calin Juravle
f6a4176d-11f5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Calin Juravle is a member of the Android Runtime Team.
Prior to joining Google Calin was a senior engineer at GreenClouds responsible for the cloud provisioning and a co-founder in a startup engaged in providing corporate management solutions. Calin earned his MSc cum laude from Utrecht University, dedicating his research on programming languages and compilers; contributing to Utrecht Haskell Compiler and prototyping automatic GPU parallelization for VectorFabrics. As a valedictorian, Calin’s passion in Computer Science unveiled from his BSc at University Alexandru Ioan Cuza of Iasi, Romania.

f719ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Pete LePage
f719ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Pete helps web developers to build the next generation of web apps. As a Developer Advocate working on the web team, he likes taking the sharp edges off bleeding edge technologies and making it easy for developers to use them. Pete helped to create Web Fundamentals, Google's resource for best practice web development, he hosts the New in Chrome video series on YouTube and has taught two Udacity courses, The Fundamentals of Responsive Web Design and Your First Progressive Web App.

f7c3ae9c-0df5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Paul Soulos
f7c3ae9c-0df5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Paul is a software engineer on Android Wear. He focuses on wearable apps, in particular fitness and calendar. Before joining Android Wear, Paul worked on essential Android phone apps and helped release the new Material Design version of Contacts for Android Lollipop. As an intern, he worked on Inbox, the successor to Gmail. 

Paul graduated with honors from Johns Hopkins University with degrees in Computer Science and Applied Mathematics. Outside of programming, Paul is interested in architecture, photography, and digital media.

f80cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Felipe Hoffa
f80cbfe1-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: In 2011 Felipe Hoffa moved from Chile to San Francisco to join Google as a Software Engineer. Since 2013 he's been a Developer Advocate on big data - to inspire developers around the world to leverage the Google Cloud Platform tools to analyze and understand their data in ways they could never before. You can find him in several YouTube videos, blog posts, and conferences around the world.

f82dc0e4-dcf5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Mike West
f82dc0e4-dcf5-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Mike is a philosophy student, cleverly disguised as a member of Chrome's security team in Munich, Germany. Since it would be slightly more than difficult to make a living sitting under a tree reading Kant, he's focused his energies on the web, which has proven itself to be a wonderful decision. Mike works on web platform security feature implementation in Chromium and Blink, and specifications in various standards bodies.

fa1f67b7-0317-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Ming Gao
fa1f67b7-0317-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Ming is a technical program manager for HP Mobile Printing initiative. He also serves as Co-Chair of Mopria steering committee. Ming is a pioneer in mobile printing. He led a team to create the first Mobile Printing app (HP ePrint) and the first printer management app (HP All-in-One Printer Remote), both of which has scaled quickly to millions of users. Ming was also in charge of releasing the first Android Print plugin (HP Print Service plugin) which now serves hundreds of millions of users worldwide. Prior to Mobile Printing work, Ming was a UNIX developer with HP-UX and X Window System/Motif library projects.

fa6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Paul Bakaus
fa6c41c3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Paul Bakaus is a Developer Advocate at Google, heading up advocacy and outreach for DevTools, AMP and Games. He assists developers, designers, and filmmakers to create better, faster, more immersive and more convincing digital experiences. Prior to joining Google, he created the popular UI library jQuery UI, now being used by over 14% of the popular web. Paul also created the Aves Engine, the worlds first prototype of a fully interactive HTML5 game engine - which he ultimately sold to Zynga.

fccea5ad-fe0b-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Tony Chen
fccea5ad-fe0b-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Tony currently leads the Android Pay In-App team.  He is on a never-ending quest to produce the perfect continuous deployment environment.  Before this current role, Tony spent some time building out Payments Infrastructure, advocating for faster testing and daily releases.  Prior to coming to Google, Tony spent time doing full stack development at various startups such as Wealthfront, Songkick and Blurb.

fd1387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Sandeep Dinesh
fd1387d5-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Sandeep started coding and creating websites when he was 12 and hasn't stopped. He is passionate about building easy-to-use products people love. Before Google, he founded an IoT startup in agriculture and developed educational HTML5 games. At Google, Sandeep's goal is to make cloud easy and help developers create the next big thing. Sandeep loves video games, making music, and martial arts, and has Bachelors in Marketing and Computer Science.

fe19ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Paul Lewis
fe19ebed-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Paul is a Developer Advocate on the Web Developer Relations team at Google. He specializes in performance and UX.

fe1a5453-0117-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Michael Huang
fe1a5453-0117-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Michael Huang is a Senior Product Manager at OpenTable, where he manages the consumer iOS and Android apps. He earned his bachelor’s degree in Operations Research from Columbia University.

fe397740-1b12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Daniel Koulomzin
fe397740-1b12-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Dan is the Technical Lead and Engineering Manager for the Android Wear System UI team.  He has worked on Android Wear since its earliest days.  Previously at Google, he has worked on Search and Google Plus.

Dan holds an MA in Computer Science from Boston University.  His bachelor’s degree was from Wesleyan University with a major in music.

fe3cca72-5c1c-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Kan Liu
fe3cca72-5c1c-e611-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Kan is the Senior Director of Product Management leading the product team for Chrome OS.   He's an Okie transplant by way of MIT with a Computer Science/Electrical Engineering degree.

fe600e52-89fa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Patrick Clary
fe600e52-89fa-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Patrick is working as Product Manager on accessibility at Google. His focus is on building targeted experiences for people with accessibility needs, and promoting inclusive design. Patrick earned bachelor's and master's degrees in Computer Science from University of Colorado at Boulder, and an MBA from Carnegie Mellon.

ff08dbe7-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Tim Hwang
ff08dbe7-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio: Tim is part of the public policy team at Google, where he focuses on issues at the intersection of law and technology. In this role, he is responsible for coordinating the company’s global policy work surrounding artificial intelligence, virtual reality, and smart cities. In 2014, he was dubbed “The Busiest Person on the Internet” by Forbes Magazine and named one of their “30 Under 30” for Law and Policy. He holds a J.D. from Berkeley Law, and earned his bachelor’s from Harvard College.

ff52e3f3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.name: Peter Lewis
ff52e3f3-c2ee-e511-a517-00155d5066d7.bio:
Peter is Product Manager for the Google beacon platform, including the open beacon format Eddystone, and Google's cloud services that integrate beacon technology with first and third party apps. Prior to Google, Peter founded a social enterprise that connects people with their local political representatives, and as a result, he became a Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts.

Peter has a doctorate in theoretical physics from Imperial College London, and master's degrees in Controlled Quantum Dynamics and Physics/Philosophy from Imperial and the University of Manchester, respectively.
